basics.name: Mostafa Elsanousi
basics.label: B.S. Computer Engineering Student
basics.summary: B.S. Computer Engineering student at Virginia Tech (GPA 3.76) seeking an internship or research opportunity in VLSI circuit design and embedded systems, with particular interest in chip-scale integration, PCB design, and hardware architecture development.

education.institution: Virginia Tech Polytechnic Institute and State University

work.name: Securis, Inc.
highlights: Performed secure data erasure on storage devices using Blancco Drive Eraser in compliance with NIST standards.
Tested and refurbished desktops, laptops, and servers for resale, redeployment, or recycling.
Conducted hardware diagnostics and component upgrades (RAM, HDD/SSD, BIOS resets).
Assisted in inventory management by tagging and tracking IT assets with barcode systems.
Supported sustainable IT lifecycle management by routing equipment for reuse or disassembly based on condition.

work.name: Magdi Algabani Group
highlights: Assisted in development of a machine learning algorithm to detect phishing attacks, enhancing cybersecurity measures.
Gained hands-on experience in software and hardware engineering focused on computer architecture and embedded systems.
Collaborated in teams and helped explain complex technical concepts to diverse audiences and business partners.

projects.name: FPGA-Based Digital Signal Processing System
projects.description: Designed and implemented an 8-tap FIR low-pass filter on a Xilinx Artix-7 FPGA (Basys 3) using Verilog HDL for real-time digital signal filtering.
highlights: Implemented 8-tap FIR low-pass filter with 200 kHz passband frequency.
Developed a pipelined filter architecture utilizing DSP slices; optimized resource utilization via symmetric tap pair addition.
Built a user interface with LCD output and color-coded LED indicators.
Integrated board switches for parameter adjustment and a 7-segment display for real-time output visualization; validated via simulation and hardware testing.
Achieved real-time processing with sub-millisecond latency during hardware testing.

projects.name: Zynq-7000 Ethernet Driver
projects.description: In progress: driver bring-up and PS/PL integration work for Ethernet on Zynq-7000.
highlights: In progress - details coming soon on bring-up, register-level debugging, and performance testing.
